title: Tips for going further
content:
This guide introduces you to the very basics of setting up and using XWiki. However, XWiki is a really powerful tool and there's much more to it than meets the eye. Here are a few resources you may want to further check out in order to find out more about what you can achieve with XWiki:



| **For everyone:** | [XWiki documentation on XWiki.org](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/): basically what it says it is :-) |
| --- | --- |
| **If you're a user:** | [The XWiki feature list on XWiki.org](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/): discover the various features XWiki has to offer and how to use them[XWiki User Guide](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/): a couple videos on how to use XWiki |
| **If you're an admin:** | The [Administrator's Guide](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/): general information for admins who need to customize their wiki (authentication, DB, performance tuning, etc.), and more generally everything you want to know about administrating XWiki, from installation to backups.* Read about [installing the standalone distribution](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Installation/InstallationStandalone/) * Discover how to [create users and groups](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/UsersAndGroupsManagement) and [handle rights on your wiki](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/RightsManagement). * Learn how to customize the look and feel of the wiki ([skin](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Skins), [color themes](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Color%20Theme%20Application), [panels](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Panels%20Application), etc.) * [XWiki Configuration](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Configuration/): most of your first questions are answered here |
| **If you're a developer:** | [XWiki, the second-generation wiki](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SecondGenerationWiki): discover why XWiki is such a powerful tool[XWiki Developer Guide](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/DevGuide/): many resources about how you can take advantage of XWiki as an application platform |

Thanks for your interest in XWiki! We look forward to seeing your project on [our References page](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/References/) soon ;-)
